heading: hello? boris?
subheading: china and former communist rival russia have set up a direct presidential hotline, the first secure telecommunications link beijing has made with a foreign capital. a foreign ministry spokesman said the hotline will allow jiang zemin and boris yeltsin to communicate on international issues "at any time." relations between china and the former soviet union have improved over the past decade, with the nations leaving behind their border skirmishes and rivalry for socialist allegiances.
author: wired staff
